subject: Self Care
title: Cultural Resistance to Self-Care
description: Learn Cultural Resistance to Self-Care in one minute.

hook.text: His father said real men don't complain. His mother said good women sacrifice everything. Neither parent taught self-care.

buildup.text: Many cultures glorify self-sacrifice and stigmatize self-care. The message: your needs come last. Always.

discovery.text: These beliefs are learned, not innate. What was taught can be unlearned. Self-care is a skill, not a trait.

twist.text: Ironically, people who practice self-care serve others more sustainably than those who sacrifice themselves completely.

climax.text: Question inherited beliefs about self-sacrifice. Ask: who benefits from me ignoring my own needs? Often, nobody does.

punchline.text: Self-care was never selfish. The culture just lied about it.

quiz.question: Why do some cultures resist self-compassion?
options: Cultural beliefs glorify self-sacrifice and stigmatize self-care
Self-compassion is a modern invention with no value
